## Table of Contents

### Classes

* [`anaconda`](#anaconda): Installs anaconda

## Classes

### <a name="anaconda"></a>`anaconda`

Installs anaconda

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `anaconda` class:

* [`anaconda_version`](#-anaconda--anaconda_version)
* [`python_env_name`](#-anaconda--python_env_name)
* [`python_env_version`](#-anaconda--python_env_version)
* [`conda_packages`](#-anaconda--conda_packages)

##### <a name="-anaconda--anaconda_version"></a>`anaconda_version`

Data type: `String[1]`

sets the version of anaconda you want to install, check: https://repo.anaconda.com/archive/

##### <a name="-anaconda--python_env_name"></a>`python_env_name`

Data type: `String[1]`

if exist, sets the name of the virtual environment

##### <a name="-anaconda--python_env_version"></a>`python_env_version`

Data type: `String[1]`

if exist, sets the version of python for the virtual environment

##### <a name="-anaconda--conda_packages"></a>`conda_packages`

Data type: `Hash`

if contains at least 1 package (name, channel and version) will be installed
